content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a simple implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col) 
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"\W", "_")
end
```
The `replace` function replaces all non-alphanumeric characters with underscores (`r"\W"`), `lowercase` converts the string to lower case, and `strip` removes any leading or trailing whitespaces.
